Prerequisites: A GRADE OF "C" OR HIGHER IN A) QMB 3003 OR MAC 2233 OR (ANY CALCULUS 1 OR HIGHER COURSE) B) ACG 3301, OR EQUIVALENTS; C) SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF ENTRANCE EXAM
Course Description: UNDERLYING CONCEPTS AND ETHICAL, REGULATORY AND BUSINESS ENVIRONMENT OF FINANCIAL REPORTING WITH EMPHASIS ON MEASUREMENT, ANALYSIS AND INTERPRETATION OF INCOME, CASH FLOWS AND FINANCIAL POSITION.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
LEARNING OUTCOMES: 
UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THE COURSE, YOU WILL BE ABLE TO:
1.	DEFINE FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING, ITS ETHICAL, PROFESSIONAL, REGULATORY AND BUSINESS ENVIRONMENT, AND ITS ROLE IN OUR ECONOMY AND SOCIETY;
2.	DISCUSS THE ESTABLISHED CONCEPTUAL FRAMEWORK FOR FINANCIAL REPORTING BY BUSINESS
ENTERPRISES;
3.	DESCRIBE A FINANCIAL REPORTING SYSTEM AND INTERRELATIONSHIPS AMONG THE COMPONENTS OF THE SYSTEM;
4.	MEASURE, ANALYZE, INTERPRET AND REPORT ACCOUNTING INCOME, CASH FLOWS, LIQUIDITY AND CURRENT FINANCIAL POSITIONS;
5.	DISCUSS THE USE OF FINANCIAL INFORMATION BY VARIOUS STAKEHOLDERS IN THEIR DECISION MAKING PROCESS;
6.	 DESCRIBE AND EVALUATE THE DIFFERENCES IN VARIOUS ACCOUNTING PROCESSES AND APPLICATIONS BETWEEN US GAAP AND IFRS.

MAJOR TOPICS
1.	THEORETICAL STRUCTURE OF FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING
2.	REVIEW OF THE ACCOUNTING PROCESS
3.	BALANCE SHEET AND FINANCIAL DISCLOSURES
4.	INCOME STATEMENT, COMPREHENSIVE INCOME, STATEMENT OF CASH FLOW
5.	REVENUE RECOGNITION/ PROFITABILITY ANALYSIS
6.	TIME VALUE OF MONEY
7.	CASH AND RECEIVABLES
8.	INVENTORY: MEASUREMENT
9.	INVENTORY: ADDITIONAL ISSUES
10.	PP&E AND INTANGIBLE ASSETS: ACQUISITION/DISPOSITION
11.	PP&E AND INTANGIBLE ASSETS: UTILIZATION/IMPAIRMENT
12.	INVESTMENTS
Textbook(s): INTERMEDIATE ACCOUNTING BY SPICELAND, SEPE, NELSON AND TOMASSINI, 8TH EDITION, MCGRAW HILL, 2015 (ISBN-0078025834/9780078025839)
